Body: Possible Duplicate:  I've rooted my phone.  Now what?  What do I gain from rooting?  What does “to root a phone” mean?  I just spent half a day finding a rooting guide for Nexus S and I was wondering why root accounts aren't available on Android phones from the beginning? Being derived from Linux, why isn't it like on Linux with the root account and other accounts?I am thinking maybe malware protection, but there are malicious software that can do harm without root account right? What are the major benefits?
Title: Why do phones have default limited user rights (not rooted)?

history.Text: I just spend half a day finding a rooting guide for Nexus S and I was wandering why root accounts aren't available on Android phones from the beginning? Being derived from Linux, why isn't it like on Linux with the root account and other accounts?I am thinking maybe malware protection, but there are malicious software that can do harm without root account right? What are the major benefits?
Why do phones have default limited user rights (not rooted)?
